results.title: [Comparative efficacy and tolerance of atenolol and midodrine in patients with vasovagal syncopes].
results.text_hl: [Comparative efficacy and tolerance of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Midodrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008879 @@@midodrine@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncopes@@@].

citations.NLM: Kuchinskaia EA, Pevzner AV, Vershuta EV, Al'bitskaia KV, Kheĭmets GI, Rogoza AN, Golitsyn SP. [Comparative efficacy and tolerance of atenolol and midodrine in patients with vasovagal syncopes]. Ter Arkh. 2006;78(4):64-8. PMID: 16821426
citations.BibTeX: @article{16821426, title={[Comparative efficacy and tolerance of atenolol and midodrine in patients with vasovagal syncopes].}, author={Kuchinskaia EA and Pevzner AV and Vershuta EV and Al'bitskaia KV and Kheĭmets GI and Rogoza AN and Golitsyn SP}, journal={Ter Arkh}, volume={78}, number={4}, pages={64-8}}

results.title: Pharmacologic approaches to therapy for vasovagal syncope.
results.text_hl: Notably, only 3 agents--@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Midodrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008879 @@@midodrine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Paroxetine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017374 @@@paroxetine@@@--have demonstrated efficacy in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncope@@@ in at least 1 prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial.

citations.NLM: Calkins H. Pharmacologic approaches to therapy for vasovagal syncope. Am J Cardiol. 1999 Oct 21;84(8A):20Q-25Q. PMID: 10568557
citations.BibTeX: @article{10568557, title={Pharmacologic approaches to therapy for vasovagal syncope.}, author={Calkins H}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={84}, number={8A}, pages={20Q-25Q}}

results.title: Head-up tilt test in complicated neurocardiogenic syncope in children.
results.text_hl: In one each, @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ and @DISEASE_Unconsciousness @DISEASE_MESH:D014474 @@@loss of consciousness@@@ without @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ and @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@ were induced. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ was tried in 5 with improvement of @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@NCS@@@ in 4 and aggravation of @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ in 1.

citations.NLM: Noh CI, Kim HS. Head-up tilt test in complicated neurocardiogenic syncope in children. J Korean Med Sci. 1997 Feb;12(1):44-8. PMID: 9142659
citations.BibTeX: @article{9142659, title={Head-up tilt test in complicated neurocardiogenic syncope in children.}, author={Noh CI and Kim HS}, journal={J Korean Med Sci}, volume={12}, number={1}, pages={44-8}}

results.title: [Therapy of vasovagal syncope (nonpharmacologic therapy and pharmacotherapy)].
results.text_hl: According to the relatively extensive number of published reports on pharmacological treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncope@@@ four preparations proved effective in randomized placebo controlled trials--@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Midodrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008879 @@@midodrin@@@, paroxetin and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@.

citations.NLM: Mitro P. [Therapy of vasovagal syncope (nonpharmacologic therapy and pharmacotherapy)]. Vnitr Lek. 2000 Dec;46(12):861-8. PMID: 11214367
citations.BibTeX: @article{11214367, title={[Therapy of vasovagal syncope (nonpharmacologic therapy and pharmacotherapy)].}, author={Mitro P}, journal={Vnitr Lek}, volume={46}, number={12}, pages={861-8}}

results.title: Lack of efficacy of atenolol for the prevention of neurally mediated syncope in a highly symptomatic population: a prospective, double-blind, randomized and placebo-controlled study.
results.text_hl: The primary hypothesis was that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is not superior to placebo for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncope@@@.

citations.NLM: Madrid AH, Ortega J, Rebollo JG, Manzano JG, Segovia JG, Sánchez A, Peña G, Moro C. Lack of efficacy of atenolol for the prevention of neurally mediated syncope in a highly symptomatic population: a prospective, double-blind, randomized and placebo-controlled study. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2001 Feb;37(2):554-9. PMID: 11216978

results.title: Response to treatment during medium-term follow-up in a series of patients with neurocardiogenic syncope.
results.text_hl: Response to treatment during medium-term follow-up in a series of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@neurocardiogenic syncope@@@.

citations.NLM: Lafuente EA, Martínez LC, Moguel JO, David RN, García JD, Tejeda AO, Reyes PH, González VR. Response to treatment during medium-term follow-up in a series of patients with neurocardiogenic syncope. Arch Med Res. 2004 Sep-Oct;35(5):416-20. PMID: 15610912

results.title: [Evaluation of beta-adrenergic blockader therapy in vasovagal syncope reproduced by head-up tilt test].
results.text_hl: Ten @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (4 @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ and 6 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, mean age 59 +/- 18 years) who suffered from recurrent @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncopes@@@ (2 to 10 attacks in 6 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and more than 10 in the other 4) with a positive initial head-up tilt test (@DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@ or severe @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ with marked @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ after a maximum of 40 minutes at 60 degrees) were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (200 mg daily in 7 cases and 100 mg daily in the other 3).

citations.NLM: Blanc JJ, Corbel C, Mansourati J, Genet L. [Evaluation of beta-adrenergic blockader therapy in vasovagal syncope reproduced by head-up tilt test]. Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss. 1991 Oct;84(10):1453-7. PMID: 1684700
citations.BibTeX: @article{1684700, title={[Evaluation of beta-adrenergic blockader therapy in vasovagal syncope reproduced by head-up tilt test].}, author={Blanc JJ and Corbel C and Mansourati J and Genet L}, journal={Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss}, volume={84}, number={10}, pages={1453-7}}

results.title: Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypotension_Orthostatic @DISEASE_MESH:D007024 @@@orthostatic hypotension@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@neurocardiogenic syncope@@@, clinical trials have demonstrated that beta-blockers, especially beta(1)-selective agents without intrinsic sympathomimetic activity such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Midodrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008879 @@@midodrine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Paroxetine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017374 @@@paroxetine@@@ can decrease recurrence of @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@.

citations.NLM: Lamarre-Cliche M. Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2002;2(1):23-35. PMID: 14727996
citations.BibTeX: @article{14727996, title={Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope.}, author={Lamarre-Cliche M}, journal={Am J Cardiovasc Drugs}, volume={2}, number={1}, pages={23-35}}

results.title: Randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of oral atenolol in patients with unexplained syncope and positive upright tilt table test results.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly improved symptoms of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasovagal syncope@@@.

citations.NLM: Mahanonda N, Bhuripanyo K, Kangkagate C, Wansanit K, Kulchot B, Nademanee K, Chaithiraphan S. Randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of oral atenolol in patients with unexplained syncope and positive upright tilt table test results. Am Heart J. 1995 Dec;130(6):1250-3. PMID: 7484777
citations.BibTeX: @article{7484777, title={Randomized double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of oral atenolol in patients with unexplained syncope and positive upright tilt table test results.}, author={Mahanonda N and Bhuripanyo K and Kangkagate C and Wansanit K and Kulchot B and Nademanee K and Chaithiraphan S}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={130}, number={6}, pages={1250-3}}

results.title: Pharmacological and electrophysiological analysis of the effects of nicotine on cat blood pressure.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@Propranolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ pretreatment potentiated the @<m>DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@vasodepressor@@@ response and was antagonized by @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine@@@.

citations.NLM: Koley J, Saha JK, Koley BN. Pharmacological and electrophysiological analysis of the effects of nicotine on cat blood pressure. Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther. 1987 May;287(1):31-47. PMID: 2888442
citations.BibTeX: @article{2888442, title={Pharmacological and electrophysiological analysis of the effects of nicotine on cat blood pressure.}, author={Koley J and Saha JK and Koley BN}, journal={Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther}, volume={287}, number={1}, pages={31-47}}
